summary: The Acquisition Reform and Cost Assessment Act of 2025 (ARCA Act of 2025) aims to reorganize the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) acquisition structure. It establishes a new acquisition organization with a dedicated Assistant Secretary and Chief Acquisition Officer, and creates offices for logistics, innovation, and procurement. The bill also introduces major acquisition program managers, mandates independent verification and validation of major programs, and establishes a Director of Cost Assessment and Program Evaluation. Furthermore, it grants the Secretary authority for other transactions with non-traditional contractors and for advance market commitments for health technologies. The bill also addresses training gaps with contracting officers and makes a clerical amendment.
